website_summaries.verdict: This solid-feeling stainless-steel option offers excellent quality for an affordable price.
pros: Stands out for its sleek design
Uses regular ground coffee so there's no need to buy expensive pods
Customers appreciate the "bold" setting for premium coffee
cons: Some units don't heat the water hot enough to make a really good cup of joe

website_summaries.verdict: A relatively inexpensive single-cup coffee maker with adjustable stand for travel mugs and standard coffee cups.
pros: Mesh filter doubles as a coffee scoop, and stores on the side of the machine
Customizable brewing for regular strength or bold coffee
Lower height that fits under most kitchen cabinets
Easy to fill the reservoir, so fresh water used for each cup
cons: Brews up to 14 oz., so larger travel mugs won't fill completely
Some users prefer to use paper filters, thinking the taste is better

customer_reviews.title: Good cup of coffee for less money!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great alternative to those expensive pods. The only thing that would make it better would be paper filters. I have started using Melitta singe serve size filters between the basket and the micro screen, this eliminates a lot of the sediment. I have added a photo of where I put the filter. I am saving lots of $$$ using this coffee maker!
customer_reviews.author: Donna C L

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Flavor and Misleading Reviews
customer_reviews.text: At first it was pretty convenient to use and did have regular cleanings with vinegar, however over time it would purely make rancid coffee no matter how many times it was cleaned. The descriptions and ratings of this product is also inconsistent. Product images show two different machines therefore the product ratings don’t accurately represent the product currently listed.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Watery coffee lovers rejoice!
customer_reviews.text: Even though it's mostly plastic, this single serve coffee maker doesn't take up a lot of space and its very easy to use. However the coffee it makes is very weak and watery, even on the "bold" setting using the minimum amount of water. I followed all instructions in the manual and used two types of ground coffee. No matter what I did, the coffee turned out weak and watery. All my attempts were made on the "BOLD" setting. It didn't do much. Still watery. Pros: -Small in size and doesn't take up much space. -Easy to use. Cons: -Watery, weak coffee. -Sprays water out rather erratically. -Mostly made of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in less than 2 years.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this one cup coffee maker when we first got it. I cleaned it regularly. But in less than 2 years it stopped making full cups of coffee. You would fill up the tank for a cup and then need to run it at least 2 to three times to empty the reservoir to get a full cup. I have had other Hamilton Beach coffee makers and other products that worked for years. This product is very disappointing. No matter what I have tried to get it to brew a full cup it's a no go.
customer_reviews.author: LSuth

customer_reviews.title: Love this coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: With social distancing in full swing my spouse and I are home A LOT. Our Keurig broke in March 2020, so we wanted to get a replacement single-serve coffee maker. At the same time, I HATE the waste associated with K-cups. Enter this coffee maker. Yes, there is a little more effort required to make a cup of coffee. You have to manually add coffee grounds and water, and have to wait for the system to brew. After each use, you have to clean the scoop and basket. But, it isn't that big of an inconvenience, and the coffee comes out at a good temp and flavorful. We are really happy with this coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Dan G.

customer_reviews.title: One of the best !!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought an Adair Grab & Go 2 years ago and have no complaints. It served me without any problem. Bought a winter home in Yuma and needed a new coffee maker. Waned to try something different. This coffee maker is a huge step up. I needed a single serve because my wife likes a milder brew. What makes this pot different from the Adair is the filtering system. This maker has a 2 tier system. Two stainless filters that eliminate any grounds in the final brew. Also the ability to brew two strengths is significant. This maker is worth the 2X price over the Adair. I will but this again
customer_reviews.author: Tom in Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Do you have extra time and enjoy plastic tasting coffee?
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at my disappointment in this model by Hamilton Beach, I have owned 4 models and usually love! 1.) This particular model after through cleaning of vinegar twice, it still had a plastic taste ruining most cups. 2.) I did not mind cleaning extra parts but then you must also take off the rubber seal to clean the disgusting excess of grounds. Also, I have to wipe of plastic around where it goes before putting back. This has to be done every other time. Really?? I am surprised no one else has committed on this. 3.) Water fill line would have been helpful. There are many more option models that work great, I don't recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, but not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: The design and concept are great. However, it takes forever for coffee to slowly drip it's way out. I don't see a difference between the blue regular vs. blue bold light as they both taste poorly. We honestly wanted to like this product but it's painful slow and half the water drips out AFTER the light indicating it's done brewing. The taste is not great. Honestly, I think if I poured hot water over my coffee grounds it would be better. It's difficult to describe the taste---like someone squeezed coffee through a hose attached to a pillow case. I'd pass on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Micro Prof

customer_reviews.title: one of the screws is defective...can't clean
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product 6 months ago and we love it. Can brew coffee perfectly, easy clean-up...and can make hot water for me tea. We no longer need to buy those k-cups anymore and saving lots of money...BUT...it clogged up and we are trying to clean it. there are four screws on the bottom of the machine, one of which is defective. it's so strange, but there is no tool that can unscrew it, so we can't get to the clog. It's almost like the top of the screw melted. So while I love this machine, I can no longer use it...I'd like to figure out how to get a hold of the company...
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Creates a mess
customer_reviews.text: Coffee just spews out the front. Design flawed basket drains slower than is filled resulting in coffee all over the counter top. I've read and followed the instructions just overflows with every cup bought this to replace my Hamilton Beach Flex brew. Will be returning this item. The coffee that does make it into the cup tasted fine but only about 2/3 makes it in the cup and I don't know about you but I don't have time to clean up the counter before work everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Cphus

customer_reviews.title: Use a #2 Cone Filter
customer_reviews.text: I have experimented with the filters. First, it's absolutely necessary to use one. Second, the single serve cup filters are too small and delicate. Third, the cone #2 work perfect. They stick out a bit around the edge, but in no way does that impede the coffee maker from doing what it needs to do. Put the filter between the mesh basket and the metal filter.
customer_reviews.author: CJP Sac

customer_reviews.title: Do not cheat customers!
customer_reviews.text: It is not stainless steel as it is in the name of the item: Hamilton Beach The Scoop Single Serve Coffee Maker, Fast Brewing, Stainless Steel (49981A),(why I bought it), it is made of plastic, and on the picture we see only the front, but water container is made of plastic, the filter is also plastic. So, I am cheated and very upset. My old one is made of plastic, and I wanted something less toxic.
customer_reviews.author: Eleonora Raikh

customer_reviews.title: Great Upgrades to an Older Model
customer_reviews.text: We had one of these from Hamilton Beach for several years that finally gave up the "ghost". Upon searching around for something different perhaps with more features , I came across literally the same type unit 2020 style! Lots of neat improvements, new on/off mechanism and you never have to replace the filter! Remember you can put your own ground coffee into the unit at a cost of 20 cents instead of using the "Cups" for around a $1.00. HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT!
customer_reviews.author: Stan S

customer_reviews.title: Easiest and tastiest coffee single cup maker
customer_reviews.text: I have had my coffee maker a few months and it is my go to coffee maker. I tried the French press, the carafe with special paper lining and the drip over a coffee mug. They are all good in their own way but for consistency and time this model works the best. I love coffee and while I enjoy the hand grinding and care of the carafe I can't make each cup of coffee seem like a Japanese tea ceremony. This works better faster and frankly produced the best taste. Easy to clean with stainless steel mesh cup and very easy instructions. You'll love it.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product.
customer_reviews.text: I recommend this coffee maker. At first it seemed to be dripping water out the front of the coffee maker but that was only because I had removed what I thought was an extra strainer that I hung on the side of the coffee maker. Once I put the extra strainer in place it was perfect. I also like that the bottom of the 3 piece coffee processor collects excess mini particles rather than have them end up in your coffee cup.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne Forbes

customer_reviews.title: Very convienent however, coffee continues to taste like plastic and have stopped using
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the coffee maker for my father to replace his 12 cup coffee maker, since he was only making coffee for himself each day. He was impressed with the machine, ease of set-up, clean-up, and overall use. I was also impressed using this over a weekend visit. However, he continues to taste plastic in his coffee after many water run through the machine and coffee uses. I wouldn't suggest to purchase and instead purchase a French press. I'm choosing to donate the machine to goodwill vice returning to manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: EcoChic1234

customer_reviews.title: Better than Kuerig!
customer_reviews.text: Love that you can choose the water level exactly and amount of grounds to use. Also with the 'bold' option for brewing you can get a much better cup of coffee than with a Kuerig. And no plastic waste! Easy to clean, looks nice and even cup height adjuster to prevent any splashing during brewing. Great product at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Smh

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: I love this coffee maker. My husband likes his coffee cold so he'll make a whole 12-cup pot and stick it in the fridge. I love hot coffee so I have to warm up my coffee each time. I decided to go for this coffee maker because it makes single cups of coffee and I don't have to buy the stupid K-cup things. I love my Kauai Estates coffee and I'm so happy that I can make a fresh cup of coffee whenever I want. It's also very easy to clean and the parts are dishwasher safe :)
customer_reviews.author: ycybarra

customer_reviews.title: Stainless Steel  Single Grinds Hamilton Beach Cup Brewer.
customer_reviews.text: Love the look of this Hamilton Beach (over my old keurig and the cuisinart) Single brew (not pods) brewer. Heavy duty stainless sharp looking. Disappointed that there was not a mug included as the photo for it shows it in the listing. Only if you scroll thru does it show it with out it and in the description. Hint I used white vinegar abouf half of cup with water and rinsed a few more cups through to get rid of the plastic taste other reviews mentioned. It worked well. I recommend using the strong brew button as the regular was too weak. I use bottled water because I have well water that deteriorates my appliances if i don't.
customer_reviews.author: MomOfFourBlueyes

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee maker  - 3 years and still working like day one!
customer_reviews.text: Best coffee maker ever had!!! Scoop and Brew! No fancy cup, filter paper, plastic "cup" - NOTHING else needed. Just add water! And I added a metal filter designed for AeroPress (like The ULTRA, Metal Filter for AeroPress) to get ride of the fine residuals. It fits right inside the cup filter that came with the unitl! Surprisingly, it is exactly the same size! 3 years so far without overpriced "cup"-like coffee, without a single filter paper and any odd "filter cup" - just pure joy of smooth coffee in the morning in less than 3 minutes - and still working like day one!
customer_reviews.author: Shadow

customer_reviews.title: Love this coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: This single serve coffeemaker is the best one I have ever used. I actually bought three of them in case one or more of them eventually break and Hamilton Beach has stopped making it. Some coffee makers make you use tap water and I won't do that. I only like water that has all the yucky stuff filtered out. I can also use a clear glass cup which some coffeemakers won't let you do.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen P.

customer_reviews.title: Seamless single serve coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: I cannot find any issue, coffee comes out well. I am not a connoisseur, but premium coffee comes out with discernible taste and I cannot detect “plastic” or other tastes or smells some have reported. It starts quick, doesn’t trip much when finished and is easy to clean. The machine is designed for travel mugs or large cups. It has a adjustable platform to support different heights of cups, still too low for a smaller 8oz European cup means more spraying; I am using an additional raiser to raise the cup close to the drip. All in all works well, easy to clean, no problems after a couple of weeks of usage.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Loved it, bought it again!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one, I loved the first one so much! Here's why: 1. Great Single cups without generating tons of trash of pods 2. Way easier to clean than reusable pods 3. No water reservoir to get funky 4. Great for making tea as well! 5. Always the exact amount for any mug I use...just fill the water from the mug I am going to use 6. Super easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: Judy H

customer_reviews.title: Just What I was Looking for!
customer_reviews.text: While waiting for this to arrive I re-visited the reviews and many had me concerned, i.e. plastic taste, not hot enough, etc. Well, these concerns turned out all for not. Absolutely none of the negative comments turned out to be true for me. The coffee I made was more then hot enough, in fact I would compare it to the temperature you get at a Donut Shop! Plastic taste? I didn't notice any. This item is exactly as advertised, a simple to use, and clean brand named coffee pot that makes a good cup of coffee. Oh yeah, a pretty darn good price too considering the alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: rytchard

customer_reviews.title: The machine of my dreams!
customer_reviews.text: All I ever wanted! Literalky added a scoop, about 10oz of water, and pushed one button and had my cup of coffee. This machine made some hot coffee with bold flavor! It makes coffee in like 2mins and is such a compact size for kitchens with limited countertop space. Furthermore, if countertops weren't an issue, I would still be using this machine here! No grinds in my coffee and it has like a double filter. Due to mixed reviews, I ordered filters that fit the machine, but Idont see where I will be needing them at this moment. Looking forward to saving money on kcups!
customer_reviews.author: Carlese C.

customer_reviews.title: Not for true coffee lovers
customer_reviews.text: If you like your coffee piping hot and a particular brand/flavor this is NOT the coffee maker for you! I actually am using this maker to Cut Back on my coffee intake and it's working like a charm! The single cup it brews looks so sad in most of my giant and oversized cup mugs. I had to switch to a different brand of coffee grounds because the 'light' brew that I typically used came out as lukewarm coffee flavored water! I'm now using a "dark roast" style grounds and less water to get a decent cup of coffee. Pros: easy to clean and very small footprint on the counter!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect when you're the only one who loves coffee in the house
customer_reviews.text: Perfect when you just want one cup of coffee or tea So far I'm loving mine and Have had it well over 3 months now had one before as well but ended up breaking it myself by dropping it during moving and ran to buy another 1 I see Review showing leaking mind personally has never leaked as long as you keep it clean it usually does not all 3 pieces were you put the coffee grounds come out to allow for cleaning And the rubber gasket on the top pops out easily and is able to be put back easily in order to clean as well If you take care of it it'll take care of you
customer_reviews.author: lacey

customer_reviews.title: Never got one cup from this. 😟
customer_reviews.text: I wanted so badly to like this coffee maker. I have a full size one but when it's being held for a brew time later in the day I want to make a single cup. I was never able to do that with this coffee maker. The water either poured out of the bottom of the machine on or it didn't fill the cup at all. I used the right size cup and placed it as directed. I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: L K

customer_reviews.title: weird taste the first few cups but excellent afterwards
customer_reviews.text: I ran a couple of cups of just water per instructions before trying to brew coffee. However, the first cup still tasted weird; like metallic or plastic. I then ran a couple of cups of water with a drop of white vinegar in the water. The first cup after that still had that weird taste. However, after a few more cups the weird taste is now completely gone and the coffee tastes great. The brew cycle is as fast (or faster) than any Keurig machine and I like being able to use any coffee I choose, in any amount I choose, instead of having to use pods.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Podvoll

customer_reviews.title: Still Need The Paper Filters
customer_reviews.text: Brews a fast cup in about two minutes. My only comment is that to avoid the sludge (mud) in the bottom of the cup it is necessary to use paper coffee filters. Even with the screened baskets, without a paper filter, sludge still gets through the screens and settles in the bottom of the cup. No big deal, I just trim a paper filter to fit into the screened basket and it does the job. A little extra work, but by doing that I don't have sludge when I get to the bottom of the cup. Otherwise this unit is a good buy. Easy to use and easy to keep clean.
customer_reviews.author: Villhelm

customer_reviews.title: This is not your typical pod style
customer_reviews.text: This is our second one. The first one lasted 7 years used 2xs plus each day. This is not your typical pod style. It has an actual scoop you fill up with coffee of your choice. It makes regular or bold. It does not hold pods (better for the environment). We also use small filters to eliminate additional chemicals. The scoop and the two parts it sets in (and this makes it different from the pod style machines) come out super easy for complete cleaning. Holds standard cups and tall mugs. Also costs less than many others. Simple, sleek, and good value.
customer_reviews.author: CharmedTote

customer_reviews.title: Flavor of plastic.
customer_reviews.text: This looks great and is easy to use,but I'm sorry to say that the coffee made in it tastes strongly of plastic. I ran three cycles of water through it and then I did vinegar just to be extra thorough and the coffee still tastes like plastic. I'm really bummed because I wanted this as an alternative to a Keurig because I think the Keurig plastic pods are very wasteful. So I'm back to the drawing board...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worst coffee maker ever !
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money!! After a week or two the water over flows and everything, hot water, coffee, everything drips
customer_reviews.author: Carole

customer_reviews.title: Just perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these I have purchased. The first one worked perfectly but I had an influx of sugar ants in the kitchen that invaded my coffee maker.By the time I killed all the ants the coffee maker was ruined. I purchased another brand because it was convenient at the time, however it wasn't nearly as good as my Hamilton Beach one so I found it on Amazon and replaced the original and now have a great morning cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda in Helena

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't get water hot enough to produce drinkable cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: I have tried 3 variations of brewing a cup of coffee, with fresh grounds at two different levels of coarseness, and using the regular or bold settings. Each time, the coffee tasted bad. then using the same ingredients (freshly ground beans, filtered water), I used my Aeropress where I can control the water temperature. The Aeropress produced a good tasting cup of coffee. Water temperature of the Hamilton Beach topped out at about 158 degrees, vs 175 degrees for the Aeropress. I frankly am going to request a refund and ship it back. Water temperature is a key quality factor and this machine doesn't produce.
customer_reviews.author: C. A. Ray

customer_reviews.title: Makes a Great Cup of Coffee, Easy to Use & Clean, Solid Stainless Steel Constuction
customer_reviews.text: No complaints. Tastes bette than K-cups at a fraction of the price. Tip: place an overturned small empty coffee cup underneath the receiving cup to keep it close to the drip output. This eliminates splashing that otherwise occurs during the drip process.
customer_reviews.author: NKQ

customer_reviews.title: Takes up a Small space and has good performance
customer_reviews.text: It has a small footprint. Is simple and easy to use, and with basic coffee (no expensiver "cups"). This is my second one. You are supposed to flush with vinegar every month or so and I did not do that (probably the case with any coffee maker). After 6 or so years mine plugged up so badly I could not unclog it so I finally replaced it. I will be a bit more careful on the new one. It works great! I cannot fault the design or construction in any way.
customer_reviews.author: R. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Don't love it
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for use with my tall travel mug because it was advertised as being 14" tall. It's not, more like 7" and the mug doesn't fit, so I have to use a short mug and then transfer to the tall one after brewing. Speaking of brewing, this thing is incredibly slow. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: James M. Steriti

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a month
customer_reviews.text: It does look good and looks like it should be easy to use. Problem is it starts to taste like plastic after a few weeks. Then it just started dropping water out Ugh not worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Roach Gnome

customer_reviews.title: The perfect coffee maker to brew just what you need without waste
customer_reviews.text: I've had this coffee maker for several years now. It's perfect for me as I'm the coffee drinker in my household so brewing a 6 cup pot of coffee doesn't make sense. Also, there is no environmentally-unfriendly waste that the k-cup brewers have. It brews the perfect, single cup of coffee to start my day. If I desire tea, it comes with a separate strainer that you can add your tea leaves into to brew a single cup of tea. It's also aesthetically pleasing on my kitchen counter with its brushed steel finish. If this broke down now, I would immediately have to buy another identical one as I wouldn't know how to survive without it.
customer_reviews.author: CH

customer_reviews.title: Just get it. No brainer.
customer_reviews.text: Several months later, the simple and cheap machine turns out great coffee. I’m the only one who uses it and I make a somewhat different cup each time multiple times daily. What I love about is the simplicity, zero maintenance or need to buy filters. I won’t be sad if it stops working because of the price point. One trick I found is to tamp the coffee gently to get even a stronger flavor. So, if you just want a regular cup of coffee this is a steal. I don’t like my coffee burning hot so this is another plus to me.
customer_reviews.author: Kakabilla

customer_reviews.title: Great machine for great price
customer_reviews.text: Love my little coffee maker. Love the feature of adjusting the height for travel mugs. Started dripping slow down once and I found there is a second screen under the cup for the coffee grounds that needs rinsed off about once a week. So much cheaper than those k-cup coffee makers
customer_reviews.author: Debrannie

customer_reviews.title: ok for a fast cup - not for a really hot, rich cup of gourmet coffee...
customer_reviews.text: First the cons: No matter how dark or rich the blend, the coffee is weak - it drips too darn fast The coffee tends to splash on the maker and counter - even with a tall cup I like my coffee really hot and this make will not get it there Now the Pros: So easy to use - and fast (which was a con too) Easy cleanup - but I haven't done any long term cleaning yet Slim profile and not bad looking Conclusion: ok for a fast cup - not for a really hot, rich cup of gourmet coffee...
customer_reviews.author: empiriGal

customer_reviews.title: Best Single Serve Brewer I’ve Owned
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker exceeded my expectations. I’ve been using it for 6 months without any issues. I love that i can use regular coffee and not have to buy pods. No coffee grounds in my coffee and it’s super easy to clean up each day. I would recommend this to every one of my friends and family that use a single serve brewer. I also love that there’s a little hook on the side to hang the scoop. Everything can be stored together and it takes up very little counter space.
customer_reviews.author: J Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: Try Aeropress filters to prevent the sludge and slow down the brewing process.
customer_reviews.text: It's a small footprint on the counter, which I like, and easy to clean up. And we don't waste coffee by brewing a bunch and not using it. I understand the 1-star reviews that complain about sludge. The BOLD setting made strong enough coffee (which means two heaping scoops for a 16oz cup), but we noticed right away that some ground coffee was making it into our cups, blech! So we purchased Aeropress filters and started using them. They not only prevent the grounds from getting into our coffee, they slow down the brewing time a bit so the coffee is even stronger. I'll give it four stars after using it for six months.
customer_reviews.author: Robink

customer_reviews.title: Better than a Keurig!
customer_reviews.text: So I'm pretty picky and I like a strong cup of coffee, and I love this machine! I got it because my family was using a Keurig, which produces tons of plastic waste. So I had to find an alternative that was easy enough for everyone to use, makes single cups, and makes good coffee. I feel like does a really good job at all 3, plus it's easy to clean. Tip for making a stronger cup of coffee: I only pour in about 6 ounces of water and then fill the coffee scoop to the top line (for 14 oz). Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Renata Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Good, inexpensive one-cup maker that uses regular ground coffee.
customer_reviews.text: An affordable, convenient one-cup maker. Uses regular ground coffee, I now conveniently make half-n-half caff-decaff. Pretty simple to clean. The whole grounds parts come out to rinse or wash. Takes little more time than microwaving instant, and is fresh brewed. The filters suggested by Amazon help it retain more fine-grind grounds, but the two permanent filters do a respectable job. I now use it every day. Not a coffee connoisseur, but really enjoy my morning coffee, buy arabica, and I think this maker does as well as any of the brewers I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: Dr D

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed that the first one I ordered was damaged
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed that the first one I ordered was damaged. I returned it and ordered a replacement the same day. The replacement arrived two days later with no damage. I've already made a couple cups of coffee. I had one of these before but it recently stopped working. When I ordered that one it came with two scoops, one that would hang on the hook on the back right side of the machine. This time I only received one scoop. Good thing I kept some of the removable parts from my old machine. I'm still waiting to hear about my refund on the original coffee maker that was received damaged. The electrical cord is 24 inches.
customer_reviews.author: Joann

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in my purchase of this coffee maker.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this coffee maker as a replacement for the maker my wife has had for about 10 years. I chose this model because I liked the style and I had never heard anything bad about Hamilton Beach products before. It looks great on the counter top but unfortunately that seems to be the only pro for this maker. After using it for a couple months and making adjustments to coffee brands, water levels and coffee levels it appears this maker will not make a strong cup of coffee even when on the bold setting. I would not recommend this coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Michael T.

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Have Been Looking For !!!!
customer_reviews.text: With just two old people in the house, the big brew apparatus had way too big footprint on the counter. Too big to make small amounts of coffee which led to wasting coffee. Made the first of two cups of coffee this morning. Used the same make/grind/decaf coffee as with the old machine. What a difference. Improved flavor. Great temp. Easy to clean up. Just make sure to follow the instructions for amounts of H2O and coffee as specified in the well presented enclosed instructions. I followed them to "the T" and had no problems. Good job Hamilton Beach and Amazon. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: I. L. Scherer

customer_reviews.title: Brews fast and automatically shuts off
customer_reviews.text: I love the way all the pieces come out to clean. The coffee brews super fast and tastes great. The filter is also the perfect size for a tea bag. Shutting off automatically when brewing is done if my favorite feature ( I always worried about remembering to shut off my other coffee pots but not anymore). Because the filter hangs down it won’t work with a super tall commuter cup like a bubba but other than that it’s a great one cup brewer
customer_reviews.author: Library Panda

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: It has a double system to keep coffee grounds out of the cup. I've been a Kuerig user ever since filters were created to allow using ground coffee (don't want to create all the extra garbage from the pods). New Kuerig systems didn't work with filters for me without adding lots of grounds to the cup. Hamilton single cup system allows me to add a lot of grounds for a strong cup of coffee. I did run plain water thru machine 3 times. First cup of coffee tasted like plastic. Second & beyond is good. Only change I would recommend to designers is to make the drip holder a separate piece for easier emptying.
customer_reviews.author: Susan E

customer_reviews.title: It overflows
customer_reviews.text: it is easy to use and clean, just like any other coffee maker. It worked well for about 2 weeks but has started overflowing (from the scoop basket and underneath, not the drip hole). We do not overfill the reservoir. Our coffee is not finely ground. When it was working better, the "regular" setting was kind of watery. "Bold" has better flavor. There is a little bit of splatter as the coffee drips so the counter needs to be wiped down after (even worse when it overflows). Too bad I cannot return this.
customer_reviews.author: GD

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed, Don't Waste Your Money!
customer_reviews.text: Cannot give this product a good review! It's easy enough to use and clean but that being said, the taste and quality of the coffee is terrible no matter what you do or how often you clean it!! The "double filter system" is practically useless, there are always coffee grounds in the bottom filter and in my cup! I have resorted to using 2 - 4 cup filters but even that doesn't change the taste or quality of the coffee save for the fact it pretty much illuminates the problem with the grounds. Tossing this POS in the trash and going back to a K-Cup coffee maker!

customer_reviews.title: The scoop Single
customer_reviews.text: For as long as I can remember I have used a plastic holder for filters. I "settled" on Starbucks French Bold and Italian Bold. Then both. I ground my own beans. I had a buddy who roasted the beans. But I'm too lazy for that. I think this machine is very cool. It cleans well, first of all. One has an option for regular and one for bold flavor. It is easy to take the metal mesh in black plastic coffee grounds holder in. The taste is something like latte at times. And no milk. Just good flavor.

customer_reviews.title: Coffee fiend wife approved!

This was our third brewer from them, and I swear their quality has gone down, and ofcourse their prices went up. Bought this to try out, loved the concept. Now the wife is the coffee fiend in the house, and was scared to take down the kureg and put this up, but it's been a month now, and she loves it!

customer_reviews.title: Great

I used 1x per day for about 3 months about 3 days a week because we work remotely the other days. The last cup I had it only brewed 1/2 cup. Then, just tried to brew a cup and it won't brew at all. It has power but nothing happens. Very Frustrating.

customer_reviews.title: Great machine at an affordable price!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great machine at an affordable price. It works with the simplicity of other machines that use pods but uses ground instead. This makes fresher coffee at a cheaper price. It can make two cup sizes and is MUCH smaller than most pod-using machines, so it doesn't take up a huge amount of counter space. It has a reusable filter which is easy to clean. No pods, paper filters, etc and the grounds go in our compost, so it's environmentally friendly as well. We are very happy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: EW

customer_reviews.title: Another great Hamilton Beach product.
customer_reviews.text: Great space-saving product for single cup users. Easy to use & clean and brews a hot cup of Joe. It is uncomfortably hot right off the bat in my ceramic lined mug without preheating but just right in a ceramic cup. The cap greatly inhibits cooling. I can get my 7-5/8" travel mug (height without cap) under the basket by removing the metal cup support and placing a small spacer in front for leveling, equal in height to the "step" at the rear. product_meta.title: Hamilton Beach Scoop Single Serve Coffee Maker, Fast Brewing, Stainless Steel (49981A)
product_meta.description:
HAMILTON BEACH THE SCOOP SINGLE-SERVE COFFEEMAKER - 49981
The scoop single-serve coffee maker goes where no coffee maker has gone before, brewing hotter, faster and better-tasting coffee than most gourmet machines out there. And, its benefits don't stop there. The scoop coffee maker utilizes the simplicity of ground coffee and brews a customizable cup quickly: an 8 oz. cup in less than 90 seconds or a 14 oz. travel mug in under two-and-a-half minutes.

Aside from its versatility in using inexpensive coffee grounds to brew a great-tasting cup, The scoop coffee maker is designed for ultra-simple preparation in three straightforward steps: 1) Scoop 2) Place 3) Brew. It features a steel mesh scoop for filtering freshly ground coffee and comes with a built-in, adjustable stand that flips to accommodate a standard-size cup or a taller travel mug.

All in all, the scoop single-serve coffee maker offers affordability and no fuss with lots of options. There's no need for extra equipment, high-tech buttons or extra equipment, either.

PRODUCT USES & UNIQUE FEATURES
ALLOWING FOR VARIOUS COFFEE GRIND TYPES
The scoop coffee maker doesn't need pre-packaged K-Cup packs or coffee pods, which can get expensive, and not to mention stale, over time. Instead, it comes with a mesh scoop filter that gives users the choice of any flavor (caramel, hazelnut, vanilla, etc.), any brand (Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts, etc.) and any strength (Regular or Bold) pleasing to their taste. 

DIFFERING BOLDNESS LEVELS
With The scoop coffee maker, versatility is key. Whether you decide to go with a mainstream brand coffee or stronger premium-brand coffee, you need a machine that understands and quickly adapts. Use the regular setting for a quick basic, automatic drip coffee, or get an upgrade and choose bold for more fine grinds, decaf or stronger flavors premium-brand coffee like Starbucks or Melitta. Just remember that the finer the grind, the longer it takes to brew. For bolder coffee, the water passes through at a slower rate, but allows more contact time and better flavor extraction for a better-tasting cup when done brewing. 

MEASURING PROPORTIONS APPROPRIATELY 
Not sure how much coffee to add when brewing? No worries -- each scoop filter is labeled with two measuring lines for exact serving amounts. And more isn't necessarily better, in this case. Overfilling the scoop doesn't allow room for brewing and water can overflow and spill over, ultimately meaning weaker coffee. 

ADJUSTING THE CUP SIZE 
Before brewing, adjust the L-shaped cup rest to make sure your cup is as close to the dispensing nozzle as possible. For travel mugs, fit the cup rest against the coffeemaker and place your mug on top of the drip tray. 

AWARD-WINNING DESIGN 
The Scoop Coffeemaker was awarded the "2012 Good Housekeeping Very Innovative Products (VIP) Award" by Good Housekeeping Research Institute. In addition, the Industrial Designers Society of America (IDSA) gave it high rankings for its ability to use coffee grinds, instead of packs or pods, and simultaneously give users the freedom to choose their own flavor, strength and cup size for their coffee. 

PRODUCT FEATURE BENEFITS
 * Costs pennies per cup, compared to leading competitors' single-size packs
 * Proportions coffee exactly with single-serve scoop filter 
 * Brews an 8 oz. cup of coffee in less than 90 seconds 
 * Built-in adjustable stand holds standard-size cup and taller travel mugs 
 * One steel mesh scoop filter included; no need for paper filters
 * Wide drip tray on base acts as a spill-resistant drain for excess coffee 
 * Settings for regular (automatic drip) and bold coffee 
 * Durable, stainless steel features ensure coffeemaker's longevity 
 * Automatically shuts off after brewing

TIPS & CARE 
Run one or two cycles through the machine before first use. When one cycle is complete, the coffeemaker automatically shuts off. When grinding your own coffee beans, remember to purchase beans that were recently roasted (within a week is best), and grind them every time you brew a fresh cup. When brewing, keep ground coffee below the max fill line and do not use more than 14 ounces (410 ml) of water. To stop brewing mid-cycle, press either regular or bold, and the unit will shut off. If there is no water in the water reservoir and a brew button is pushed, the unit will not brew.
